fields.headline: Show us your drawers
fields.bodyText: Mouthwash If you've had a rough night and you smell like death, it's good to have mouthwash. I'd like to pretend it's for dental reasons, but it's mainly so people don't pass out when they walk past. Painkillers This seems like something of a hangover drawer - but I also use these when I get a headache from staring at a screen for too long. Wipes They always come in handy. They say telephone cleaning wipes, but you'd have to be a bit nuts to clean your telephone every time after you've picked it up. I use these to clean up coffee spills or whatever. Spare shoes I sometimes walk to work in trainers, and I got sick of lugging my shoes back and forward so I now keep a pair here. It's not like I sometimes decide to change them in the middle of the day or anything. Mini-basketball I'm a guy and I work with a lot of guys and it gets a bit testosterone-filled sometimes. We chuck the ball around, and there's a hoop on one of the desks. It' s not strictly allowed, but no one minds. I think. Ketchup sachets There's never enough on burgers or chips, and I always forget to pick up enough. So I once brought back loads and I'm still going through them. Power shakes This is going to sound bad, but I got hit a couple of months ago and broke my jaw. I was kissing the wrong girl. I had it wired shut for eight weeks and I couldn't eat solid food. So I had to have hundreds of power shakes, but I still lost a stone and felt hungry all the time. It's not even like I'm a fighting kind of guy - I don't want people to get the wrong idea about me. It was just bad luck I guess. · Hugo Walsh, an accountant, was talking to Ravi Somaiya
